67.context: NodeContext: Wyll is in a great, celebratory mood

176.speaker: Wyll
176.context: NodeContext: Wyll is in a great, celebratory mood

181.speaker: Wyll
181.context: NodeContext: Wyll is in a great, celebratory mood

357.speaker: Wyll
357.text: There you are, my love! A bit less corporeal than I imagined, but looking splendid all the same!
357.context: NodeContext: Wyll is in a great, celebratory mood

336.speaker: Wyll
336.text: There you are, Lae'zel! A bit less corporeal than I imagined, but looking splendid all the same!
336.context: NodeContext: Wyll is in a great, celebratory mood

210.speaker: Wyll
210.text: There you are, Lae'zel! A bit less corporeal than I imagined, but looking splendid all the same!
210.context: NodeContext: Wyll is in a great, celebratory mood

806.speaker: Wyll
806.text: There you are! A bit less corporeal than I imagined, but looking splendid all the same!
806.context: NodeContext: Wyll is in a great, celebratory mood

93.speaker: Wyll
93.text: There you are! A bit less corporeal than I imagined, but looking splendid all the same!
93.context: NodeContext: Wyll is in a great, celebratory mood

776.speaker: Wyll
776.text: What's the word on the rebellion? I presume you've cracked open more kith'raki heads than you could possibly count.

285.speaker: Player
285.text: Thirteen kith'raki, twenty-five sarths, and three-hundred-five warriors. Precisely.

541.speaker: Wyll
541.text: Then you did keep count. I should've known you would!

279.speaker: Wyll
279.text: My kill count's much lower, I fear - though I slip away for a hunt when I can. I may no longer be the Blade, but my heart is never far from the frontiers.

467.speaker: Wyll
467.text: That said, rebuilding a city requires less a sharp blade and more a politic mind.

61.speaker: Wyll
61.text: Bargains must be made, coin must change hands, tongues must be held in check.

656.speaker: Wyll
656.text: Father leaves me to my own devices - though he's got no shortage of advice when I ask for it.

361.speaker: Wyll
361.text: Still, I make the decisions I see fit, the ones I think will restore the city to glory. I serve only  Baldur's Gate -
361.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

434.speaker: Wyll
434.text: - not a devil of the First Hell.
434.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

19.speaker: Player
19.text: I miss you so much, Wyll.
19.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

872.speaker: Wyll
872.text: By day, I bargain with dusty bureaucrats and fuss over documents that would make a devil blush. By night, I sleep alone, longing for your touch.

100.speaker: Wyll
100.text: But I love you no less now than ever. And I love that you are fighting for your people.

57.speaker: Wyll
57.text: But I love you no less now than ever. And I love that you devoted your talents to such a dear friend.

954.speaker: Wyll
954.text: I will wait for you, I promise - no matter how many sunsets pass. You are my heart.

576.speaker: Player
576.text: And you are mine. I'll join you in Baldur's Gate as soon as I can.

160.speaker: Wyll
160.text: Nothing could make me happier. Gods, what a treasure you are.

535.speaker: Player
535.text: My beautiful man. You've always been such a softie.

861.speaker: Wyll
861.text: Not always. But once I met you, well - love has a way of tempering a blade's edges.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: It could be a while, you know. Can you really wait that long?

192.speaker: Wyll
192.text: I'll wait until the hot Hells freeze over and the cold Hells melt away. Let forever pass, if it must. Time itself can't keep us apart.

332.speaker: Player
332.text: I miss you so much, Wyll.
332.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

842.speaker: Player
842.text: I've missed travelling with you. You were a pleasure to be around.
842.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

517.speaker: Player
517.text: I've missed travelling with you. You were a pleasure to be around.
517.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

261.speaker: Player
261.text: Your father is on the council? Then Mizora kept her promise.
261.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

314.speaker: Wyll
314.text: He appeared at the family home the day after the Absolute fell. Confused, dishevelled - but unharmed.

409.speaker: Wyll
409.text: I told him the truth of things. Of the pact, of the tadpoles - all of it. And for the first time in seven years, I felt his embrace.

781.speaker: Wyll
781.text: Now he's back in his element - commanding the Flaming Fist with as brave a heart as ever, and with nary a scolding or lashing.

521.speaker: Player
521.text: What's happened to your father? Did Mizora make good on her promise?
521.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

739.speaker: Player
739.text: Speaking of your father, how is he holding up?
739.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

101.speaker: Wyll
101.text: Father's very well, and back in his element - commanding the Flaming Fist with as brave a heart as ever.

449.speaker: Wyll
449.text: Florrick, bless her soul, convinced him to withhold the lashings and scoldings, though I know he was tempted.

786.speaker: Wyll
786.text: Father's very well, and back in his element - commanding the Flaming Fist with as brave a heart as ever, and with nary a scolding or lashing.

892.speaker: Player
892.text: It's good to see you doing so well, Wyll. You always were my hero, and now you're rebuilding the city I love.
892.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

632.speaker: Player
632.text: How's the city faring? A lot's changed, I imagine.
632.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

609.speaker: Player
609.text: The city's changed a lot under your leadership.
609.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

792.speaker: Wyll
792.text: I've had more than a few challenges, given the horns sprouting from my head.

783.speaker: Wyll
783.text: For the good, I like to think. Brick by brick, stone by stone, it's started to heal. Though I've met my fair share of challenges.

798.speaker: Player
798.text: I've kept a close eye on you from the Cloister. You're already leaving a mark on Baldur's Gate.
798.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

320.speaker: Wyll
320.text: I've felt your gaze. Whenever a chill passes through me, I know Shar's favoured is close.

918.speaker: Player
918.text: Your works ripple all the way to Elysium. You're leaving quite a mark on the city.
918.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

745.speaker: Wyll
745.text: Ah, so the God of Ambition has had his eye on me. I'm flattered, old chum.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Your works ripple through the Weave. You've already left a mark on the city.
18.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

150.speaker: Wyll
150.text: Am I hearing this right? Has the great wizard Gale been keeping tabs on the Gate? Consider me flattered.
150.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

60.speaker: Wyll
60.text: I like to think I've had a healing touch. Baldur's Gate rises again, brick by brick, stone by stone.
60.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

747.speaker: Wyll
747.text: Which isn't to say I've gone without opposition.
747.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

353.speaker: Wyll
353.text: The people know me as one of the champions who saved their beloved city. They know Ravengard blood flows through my veins.
353.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

220.speaker: Wyll
220.text: The patriars, the aristocracy, the councils of Waterdeep and Amn? Their arms aren't so wide open.
220.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

445.speaker: Wyll
445.text: Still, there's no friction that can't be greased with a sly promise or a proposition.
445.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

416.speaker: Player
416.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

136.text: Ah. A kiss as sweet as the first you ever gave me.
136.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll kisses you. Short version.

11.speaker: Wyll
11.text: Ah. A kiss as sweet as the first you ever gave me.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: What's happened to Baldur's Gate's Council of Four?

56.speaker: Wyll
56.text: I don't expect a soldier or street-sweeper to see through the schemes of a tyrant like Gortash.

642.speaker: Wyll
642.text: But the city's lords and ladies were all too eager to abandon their oaths and bend the knee.

47.speaker: Wyll
47.text: My father, Ulder Ravengard, is now Grand Duke of the Triad, Keeper of the Fist.

720.speaker: Wyll
720.text: Florrick is Grand Duke of the Crossing, The Face of Devotion.

544.speaker: Wyll
544.text: Cordula Eltan is the Duke of the Seatower, a Legacy Reborn.

350.speaker: Wyll
350.text: And I am Wyll Ravengard, Grand Duke of the Wyrm, Heart of the Gate.

782.speaker: Wyll
782.text: We will yet be Four. Until such time - and after - we will enact the will of the people's Parliament.

646.speaker: Wyll
646.text: Baldur's Gate is nothing without its citizens, both in the Upper and Lower. Our duty is to them, and only them.

484.speaker: Wyll
484.text: Liara Portyr is now Grand Duke of the Wilds, Sickle of Chult.

195.speaker: Player
195.text: You've opened the gates to every and all refugees. A wise choice, do you think?

809.speaker: Wyll
809.text: The Jewel of the Coast will shine ever bright, welcoming the weak and the weary, from wherever they hail.

476.speaker: Player
476.text: You've opened the gates to every and all refugees. A wise choice, do you think?

218.speaker: Wyll
218.text: I do. Unlike your Sharrans, I strive to live in the light.

631.speaker: Wyll
631.text: We are building new housing - not just shanties, but homes where families can rest their heads, plant gardens, pursue happiness.

199.speaker: Wyll
199.text: Amazing, what can be done when Parliament and the Council pressure the upper city elites to open their coffers.

237.speaker: Wyll
237.text: I'm sure the Silvershields can make do without a few more jewelled crowns.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: When we first arrived at the city, refugees were swarming the bridge. I understand things have changed.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: And the Flaming Fist? Gortash turned them into his personal attack dogs.

943.speaker: Wyll
943.text: Father's back in his element - commanding the Flaming Fist with as brave a heart as ever, and delivered them nary a scolding nor lashing.

485.speaker: Wyll
485.text: The likes of Gortash can bend people's minds with a few chosen words, no tadpole needed.

767.speaker: Wyll
767.text: Bane's Chosen primed the Fist for a war they weren't meant to win. He convinced them there was an assassin hiding in every shadow, that cruelty was the correct answer to crisis.

887.speaker: Wyll
887.text: With a few exceptions, Father's pardoned every last Fist. 'If my forgiveness not be Tyr's will, so be it. I shall forgive them all the same.' His words, not mine.

874.speaker: Wyll
874.text: He still believes in the bow and the blade. But with Florrick's help, he's teaching the Fist a new lesson:

384.speaker: Wyll
384.text: He still believes in the bow and the blade. But he's teaching the Fist a new lesson:

35.speaker: Wyll
35.text: 'Valour is found not in the wounds you inflict, but in the lives that you've bettered.'

583.speaker: Wyll
583.text: May they all take it to heart.

630.speaker: Wyll
630.text: I've entrusted the Fist to Florrick. She commands the Flaming Fist with as brave a heart as ever, and delivered them nary a scolding or lashing.

311.speaker: Wyll
311.text: With a few exceptions, Florrick's pardoned every last Fist. 'I will not make them drink the poison of my own resentment.' Her words, not mine.

702.speaker: Wyll
702.text: Like my father, she believes in the bow and the blade. But she's teaching the Fist a new lesson:

917.speaker: Wyll
917.text: I've entrusted the Fist to Cordula Eltan. Who better than a descendant of its founder to guide them?

589.speaker: Wyll
589.text: Given the atrocities the Fist committed under Gortash, I expected her to thrash every last one. But she didn't do so much as scold them.

312.speaker: Wyll
312.text: With a few exceptions, Eltan's pardoned every last Fist. 'Gortash led the parched Fist to Bane's bloody well. I refuse to punish the thirsty for drinking from it.' Her words, not mine.

316.speaker: Wyll
316.text: They've fallen under my command for the time being.

875.speaker: Wyll
875.text: I considered thrashing every last one of them for the fears they stoked in Gortash's name. But I didn't have the heart for so much as a scolding.

277.speaker: Wyll
277.text: So I pardoned every last one. Gortash led the parched Fist to Bane's bloody well. I refuse to punish the thirsty for drinking from it

752.speaker: Wyll
752.text: I still believe in the bow and the blade. But I'm teaching the Fist a new lesson:

144.speaker: Player
144.text: You are in good spirits tonight. Married life suits you, I presume.

209.speaker: Wyll
209.text: Every moment we spend together is a celebration.

560.speaker: Wyll
560.text: The night we married, the sky lit up with fireworks. My eyes are still filled with their glitter and gold.

558.speaker: Wyll
558.text: We danced until the sun threatened to peek above the horizon.

722.speaker: Player
722.text: You are in good spirits tonight. Partnered life suits you, I presume.

424.speaker: Wyll
424.text: Every moment we spend together is a joy. And it so happens that someone else has joined the family celebration.

0.speaker: Wyll
0.text: Lily Aurora Ravengard. Treasure of a girl, found at the entrance of the Open Hand Temple - one grey eye, one brown.

524.speaker: Wyll
524.text: The Crying God's faithful thought it a sign. They summoned me the very next day.

964.speaker: Wyll
964.text: Four months of age at most - a mote of love in its purest form. She is perfection.

169.speaker: Wyll
169.text: When I'm gone, the four pillars will live with her - courage, justice, insight, strategy. May they guide her down the path with the brightest star at its end.

744.speaker: Player
744.text: Are you and your illithid lover still together?

227.speaker: Wyll
227.text: Yes. Though our 'togetherness' isn't so 'together' as we'd like.

302.speaker: Wyll
302.text: Illithids hunt in the shadows. I can offer diversion, comfort, the pleasure of company...

430.speaker: Wyll
430.text: ... but I can only do so much to warm the chill of the Undercity. My beloved deserves the revel of a full life, not a haunted existence.

333.speaker: Wyll
333.text: Yet we stay devoted. Such is the power of love.

137.speaker: Player
137.text: Mizora's gets involved every chance she gets, I imagine.

250.speaker: Wyll
250.text: Mizora's kept me on a long leash, if you can believe it.

452.speaker: Wyll
452.text: She hasn't ordered any murder sprees or any diabolical errands. But she insists on joining diplomatic missions in human guise.

438.speaker: Wyll
438.text: Her beauty and bargaining talents have even been a boon. Neverwinter's Lord denied me a boatful of his finest masons -

933.speaker: Wyll
933.text: - 'til Mizora pressed her lips to his ear. A whisper breathed, a bargain made.

651.speaker: Wyll
651.text: Whatever her game, I'm bound by her rules. My future'll never be fully my own.

194.speaker: Wyll
194.text: But I'll fall on my own blade and join the Blood War in an instant should Zariel's Hells-touched fingers stretch towards Baldur's Gate.

421.speaker: Player
421.text: I bet Mizora still sticks her nose in wherever she can.

930.speaker: Wyll
930.text: You'd think she'd have made a mess at every turn, yeah?

410.speaker: Wyll
410.text: Turns out she's kept me on a loose leash.

301.speaker: Wyll
301.text: She hasn't ordered a single murder spree or any diabolical errands. She knows I'd sooner fall on my own sword than put the city in danger.

325.speaker: Wyll
325.text: Though she does insist on joining diplomatic missions in human guise.

762.speaker: Player
762.text: Fucking Mizora. I bet you're glad to be rid of her.

254.speaker: Wyll
254.text: The hexes and eldritch blasts? Losing them took getting used to. They left behind a cold abyss where fire once raged.

559.speaker: Wyll
559.text: So I stoked a new one. Now the burning comes from within me, not from the depths of Avernus.

703.speaker: Player
703.text: I don't suppose you ever miss Mizora?

507.speaker: Wyll
507.text: The hexes and eldritch blasts? Losing them took getting used to. They left behind a cold abyss where fire once raged.

494.speaker: Wyll
494.text: I'm afraid since we last met, my corpse count remains a paltry zero. Unless you count the boars I've felled on ducal hunts.

791.speaker: Wyll
791.text: Rebuilding a city requires a politic mind. A sharp soldiering blade, not so much.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: I've turned my mind to political concerns. We seek a powerful ally: the githzerai.

163.speaker: Wyll
163.text: Ah, diplomacy - not so different from fighting, I find. You still grip your blade, you just hide it beneath a silken glove.

944.speaker: Wyll
944.text: I am no stranger to it myself. A city is not rebuilt with the simple wave of a duke's hand.

832.speaker: Player
832.text: It continues apace, though it will take time to topple a powerful queen like Vlaakith.

661.speaker: Wyll
661.text: Not to mention the mightiest magic you can muster and the sharpest swords you can forge.

729.speaker: Wyll
729.text: My edge may not be so sharp as yours, but I still slip away for a hunt when I can. My heart is never far from the frontiers.

932.speaker: Wyll
932.text: My own blade's dulled a bit, I'm afraid. Unless you count the boars I've slain on ceremonial hunts, I haven't felled a single beast since the Absolute fell.

595.speaker: Wyll
595.text: Gods, it's so good to see you. It's been far too long.
595.context: NodeContext: Good natured, fun, not mean.

392.speaker: Wyll
392.text: I - hold on a moment. *Sniff.* Do you smell that?
392.context: NodeContext: Good natured, fun, not mean.

780.speaker: Player
780.text: Breathe deeply and take in the scents around you.
780.context: NodeContext: Good natured, fun, not mean.

518.speaker: Player
518.text: Not even a whiff of fresh blood. You're such a damn tease.
518.context: NodeContext: Good natured, fun, not mean.

491.speaker: Wyll
491.text: Dammit, Astarion! Honeysuckle and jasmine hang in the air, and you're still thinking of open wounds and dripping cadavers.
491.context: NodeContext: Good natured, fun, not mean.

748.speaker: Wyll
748.text: Still as charismatic as ever, I'd hasten to add.

594.speaker: Wyll
594.text: I wish we'd caught up before now, but time is so fleeting. If only I could rebuild the city with a wave of the hand.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: I'm getting fragrant flowers and a mysterious accent I can't quite place.

217.speaker: Wyll
217.text: I haven't visited since the Absolute fell. Turns out, rebuilding a city requires more than a simple wave of a duke's hand.

451.speaker: Player
451.text: I smell the clean night air and a faint whiff of ale. Perfect party ambience.

450.speaker: Wyll
450.text: Oh, how right you are, and how wonderful it is. I've had so little time for simple pleasures like this in the two months past.

340.speaker: Wyll
340.text: Turns out, rebuilding a city requires more than a simple wave of a duke's hand.

370.speaker: Player
370.text: Smell what? The material plane can hardly compete with the aromas of Elysium.

929.speaker: Wyll
929.text: You don't know what you're missing. The sweetness of honeysuckle, the earthiness of split bark.

202.speaker: Wyll
202.text: I've had so little time to stop and notice life's small wonders. Turns out, rebuilding a city requires more than a simple wave of a duke's hand.

928.speaker: Wyll
928.text: Bargains must be made, alliances must be forged, customs must be considered.

665.speaker: Player
665.text: Hm. I'm not noticing anything special.

313.speaker: Wyll
313.text: My love, my heart. Breathe deep - can you smell it?
313.context: NodeContext: A deep breath after 'breathe deep'

641.speaker: Player
641.text: Breathe deeply and take in the scents around you.

755.text: *You breathe in every scent the night breeze carries. Sweet honeysuckle, tender violets - and an earthy fragrance you immediately recognise: oakwood.*

103.speaker: Narrator
103.text: *You breathe in every scent the night breeze carries. Sweet honeysuckle, tender violets - and an earthy fragrance you immediately recognise: oakwood.*

805.speaker: Player
805.text: Deep, pungent wood. It reminds me of the Wilden Oak - and the night you proposed.

669.speaker: Wyll
669.text: I hoped you would remember. Can you believe we haven't been there since that very eve?

373.speaker: Wyll
373.text: Time is so precious. If only I could rebuild the city with a wave of the hand.

393.speaker: Wyll
393.text: Instead, I must devote myself to political bargains, forging alliances, keeping to custom.

400.speaker: Wyll
400.text: You've been patient through it all. Your love is the fuel that drives me forward.

459.speaker: Wyll
459.text: Have you been... comfortable in the Undercity? Is there anything more I can bring you?

294.speaker: Player
294.text: You have been an exemplary partner under the circumstances. I want for nothing.

463.speaker: Wyll
463.text: And yet deserve so much more.

890.speaker: Wyll
890.text: Oh, before I forget - I've made contact with an assassin, name of Artemis, a killer of killers. Certain arrangements can be made.

381.speaker: Player
381.text: Only so many criminals stalk the Undercity. I need more food, Wyll.

812.speaker: Wyll
812.text: I... I know, and I can help. I've made contact with an assassin, name of Artemis, a killer of killers. Certain arrangements can be made.

846.speaker: Wyll
846.text: Your hunger requires sating. And I mean to provide.

397.speaker: Wyll
397.text: How I wish I could show you off in the High Hall instead of hiding you away. If only life were so simple.

698.speaker: Player
698.text: Your father is on the council? Then Mizora kept her promise.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: What's happened to your father? Did Mizora make good on her promise?

310.speaker: Player
310.text: How's the city faring? A lot's changed, I imagine.

196.speaker: Player
196.text: Let me guess: Mizora's involved herself in your business every chance she gets.

338.speaker: Wyll
338.text: She hasn't dared flash her wings since we crushed the Netherbrain and freed the infected.

411.speaker: Wyll
411.text: Of course, she took my every last hex and fiendish power along with her. Took some getting used to. They left behind a cold abyss where fire once raged.

546.speaker: Wyll
546.text: It's so freeing, to be together like this outside the confines of the shadows.

976.speaker: Wyll
976.text: I love you. Don't ever forget that.

817.speaker: Wyll
817.text: Go on, the night's young. I don't plan on wasting a moment of it.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: I just want more time with you. I miss you.

797.speaker: Wyll
797.text: I miss you too. If only ducal life afforded me more time.

471.speaker: Wyll
471.text: I'm glad father's left us to our own devices, more or less - though he's got no shortage of advice when I ask for it.

773.speaker: Wyll
773.text: But we will make the decisions we see fit, the ones that'll restore the city to glory.

432.speaker: Wyll
432.text: What word from the scouts? Have we finally rid ourselves of the githyanki threat?

531.speaker: Player
531.text: I will eradicate any raider who dares approach the city. You have my word.

779.speaker: Wyll
779.text: I could never doubt you, Lae'zel of K'liir - I only wish I could join you. My focus must remain on the Gate.

764.speaker: Player
764.text: They've located a gith stronghold in the jungle of Chult. I plan to slit every sarth neck I find there.

55.speaker: Wyll
55.text: And you will rise victorious, Lae'zel of K'liir, as you always do. I wish I could join you, but my focus must remain on the Gate.

586.speaker: Player
586.text: Tonight is for celebration, not worrying about Vlaakith's petty thugs.

184.speaker: Wyll
184.text: Right you are. But even tonight, beneath the Tears of Selûne, the city isn't far from my mind.

953.speaker: Wyll
953.text: I now serve only you and Baldur's Gate, not a devil of the First Hell.

949.speaker: Player
949.text: How is your father holding up? He's keeping the Flaming Fist in line, I gather.

233.speaker: Wyll
233.text: Indeed he is - and with nary a lashing or scolding, to my surprise.

935.speaker: Player
935.text: I never imagined you'd leave such a mark on the city, and so quickly.

276.speaker: Wyll
276.text: All for the good, I like to think - though I've met my fair share of challenges.

733.speaker: Player
733.text: You haven't mentioned the Council of Four since you disbanded it.

813.speaker: Wyll
813.text: It is to be reborn - a bettered council befitting a bettered city.

230.speaker: Wyll
230.text: I am Wyll Ravengard, Grand Duke of the Wyrm, Heart of the Gate.

12.speaker: Wyll
12.text: And there's another I'd like to nominate - Grand Duke of the Coast, Doom of the Dead Three.

31.speaker: Wyll
31.text: Namely, I nominate you. Please say you'll accept.

547.speaker: Player
547.text: I accept. I will join you on the Council as a Grand Duke.

65.speaker: Wyll
65.text: Then we've a reason to celebrate tonight twice over. Hail Grand Duke of the Coast, Doom of the Dead Three!

473.speaker: Wyll
473.text: The city's future looks brilliant indeed.

807.speaker: Player
807.text: I'm honoured you would consider me. But I have to decline.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: Not on your life. I'd rather leave the politics to you.

573.speaker: Wyll
573.text: I understand. But I am no less grateful for you, and for us. Without you at my side, this city wouldn't shine half as bright.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: The city's finally opened its gate to refugees. And it has you to thank.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: The Flaming Fist were in need of reform. Has there been any progress on that front?

900.speaker: Wyll
900.text: Go on, my love - the night's young. You shouldn't waste a moment of it.

337.speaker: Player
337.text: I wish we could have brought Lily. She'd be the life of the party.

898.speaker: Narrator
898.text: *Your soul warms thinking of Lily Aurora Ravengard, your adopted daughter. A treasure of a girl, found at the entrance of the Open Hand Temple - one grey eye, one brown.*

425.speaker: Narrator
425.text: *The Crying God's faithful thought it a sign. They summoned Wyll the very next day.*

654.speaker: Wyll
654.text: Ah, the girl could melt the staunchest heart. She might even have brought a smile to old Withers' face!

287.speaker: Wyll
287.text: But tonight is for us - and Lily's only four months of age, besides. I promise, the Temple will keep her in good care.

139.speaker: Player
139.text: I figured Mizora would be stirring the pot at every chance. I'm pleasantly surprised.

650.speaker: Player
650.text: Hells, I'm glad to have Mizora out of our lives.

453.speaker: Wyll
453.text: That makes two of us - though losing the hexes and eldritch blasts took getting used to. They left behind a cold abyss where fire once raged.

864.speaker: Player
864.text: Not even a whiff of fresh blood. You're such a damn tease.

840.speaker: Wyll
840.text: Dammit, my love. Honeysuckle hangs in the air, and you're thinking of open wounds and dripping cadavers! Ah, but what does it matter?

855.speaker: Player
855.text: I smell the clean night air and a faint whiff of ale. Perfect party ambience.

768.speaker: Wyll
768.text: Oh, how right you are. Not since our wedding have we enjoyed an evening so jubilant.

682.speaker: Wyll
682.text: Oh, how right you are, and how wonderful it is. We've had too little time for pleasures like these.

153.speaker: Player
153.text: Smell what? The material plane can hardly compete with the aromas of Elysium.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Hm. I'm not noticing anything special.

601.speaker: Wyll
601.text: Not the sweet honeysuckle, the heady jasmine? Oh, but what does it matter?

838.speaker: Wyll
838.text: We are among old friends under the twinkling stars. Not since our wedding have we enjoyed an evening so jubilant.

111.speaker: Wyll
111.text: We are among old friends under the twinkling stars. We've had too little time for pleasures like these.

893.speaker: Wyll
893.text: A welcome reprieve from the faraway missions and bargaining tables of the months past.

1.speaker: Wyll
1.text: Oh, I didn't mean - well, I didn't mean that. I'd just gutted the ogre, not...
1.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

894.speaker: Wyll
894.text: How about I change the subject before I dig this hole any deeper?
894.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

398.speaker: Wyll
398.text: You look positively perfect. If a bit shimmery around the edges.
398.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

799.speaker: Wyll
799.text: How fares the Comet's path? I wager you've cracked open more kith'raki heads than you could possibly count.
799.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

348.speaker: Player
348.text: Thirteen kith'raki, twenty-five sarths, and three-hundred-five warriors. Precisely.
348.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

351.speaker: Wyll
351.text: How you'd thrill in the Blade's hunt. The trolls I've torn open, the ghouls I've cleaved - the stories I've been itching to tell.
351.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

88.speaker: Wyll
88.text: How you'd thrill in the Blade's hunt, Lae'zel. The trolls I've torn open, the ghouls I've cleaved - the stories I've been itching to tell.
88.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

638.speaker: Player
638.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

689.speaker: Player
689.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

611.speaker: Player
611.text: Go on, Mister Blade. Let's see how you stack up against me!
611.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

433.speaker: Wyll
433.text: You want to hear about the stegosaurus that bullied Candlekeep, the impossible lich, or the young dragon who crawled out of Deeping Cave?
433.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

593.speaker: Player
593.text: A dinosaur battle? Tell me every bloody detail.
593.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

831.speaker: Wyll
831.text: Wizards have a penchant for unusual pets, as you very well know. A flying cat? Delightful. A menagerie of dinosaurs, on the other hand...

429.speaker: Wyll
429.text: The wizard in question was called Rylen. Had a half-dozen eggs smuggled into Candlekeep from the jungle.

42.speaker: Wyll
42.text: Did you know it takes three tendays for a hatchling stegosaurus to reach the size of a cave bear?

102.speaker: Wyll
102.text: Rylen sure didn't. Wasn't a month before the place was overrun by rampaging stegos. The Great Readers dealt with five of them without too much trouble. The remaining one, well...

673.speaker: Wyll
673.text: ... young Rylen cast Enlarge on it by mistake. The beast rampaged through the baths, demolished Oghma's temple, and smashed through the east wall.

770.speaker: Wyll
770.text: Stegos may not have much taste for meat, but they've got a hell of a temper. Luckily, this one had only clobbered a few farmhouses once I'd caught up.

238.speaker: Wyll
238.text: The ground shook as it charged me. I vaulted over the beast and grabbed it by the tail. It bucked and bellowed as I climbed its plates and straddled its head.

256.speaker: Wyll
256.text: I plunged a blade into the left eye, straight to the brain. It fell to the ground with a thud; bet the ravens are still picking at its carcass to this day.

962.speaker: Wyll
962.text: Wizards have a penchant for unusual pets. A flying cat? Delightful. A menagerie of dinosaurs, on the other hand...

394.speaker: Player
394.text: The lich, most certainly. It must have posed quite the challenge.
394.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

912.speaker: Wyll
912.text: It did - though the adventure had peaceful beginnings, as so many often so.
912.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

675.speaker: Wyll
675.text: I'd made camp south of Daggerford. The night was calm, lit by the green lanterns of a caravan. I was about to dig into a hearty stew when it began:
675.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

127.speaker: Wyll
127.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

291.speaker: Wyll
291.text: It was as if a thousand skeletons were walking the skies and had split into pieces. Skulls, knuckles, ribs rained down on me.
291.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

801.speaker: Wyll
801.text: I shielded myself with Armour of Agathys and made for the light. The bones clumped and clattered into unspeakable aberrations.
801.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

566.speaker: Wyll
566.text: I turned my skin to bark and made for the light. The bones clumped and clattered into unspeakable aberrations.
566.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

391.speaker: Wyll
391.text: I cast and carved until I reached the light. I found no caravan, but a sickly-green lich. Each fallen bone was a shard of its essence. An impossibility!
391.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

269.speaker: Wyll
269.text: Ah, but what does a world of Netherbrains and magic crowns care about the impossible?
269.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

614.speaker: Wyll
614.text: I raged through the night. By morning, the fields were buried in shards of bone, the lich's included.
614.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

866.speaker: Player
866.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

138.text: Ah. A kiss as sweet as the first you ever gave me.
138.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll kisses you. Short version.

122.speaker: Wyll
122.text: Ah. A kiss as sweet as the first you ever gave me.

540.speaker: Player
540.text: I've missed travelling with you. You were a pleasure to be around.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: I've missed travelling with you. You were a pleasure to be around.

162.speaker: Wyll
162.text: I know you're doing what's best for Karlach. If the roles were reversed, I'd have done the same.

957.speaker: Wyll
957.text: But a pang still strikes my chest when I imagine the two of you slaying devils without me.

973.speaker: Wyll
973.text: Do what you must, for yourself and for Karlach. I will be here waiting for you. Always.

966.speaker: Wyll
966.text: When I look to the sky, I imagine you atop a red dragon, soaring across the endless night.

412.speaker: Wyll
412.text: And when my body gives way to exhaustion, I picture your dragon landing beside me. You dismount, we lock eyes - and you sink into my waiting arms.

670.speaker: Wyll
670.text: And one day, I know we will make this dream a reality.

156.speaker: Player
156.text: Incredible story. I wish I'd been there to see it play out.

575.speaker: Wyll
575.text: I wish you'd been there to join in! Oh, to battle together, just like the old days.

951.speaker: Wyll
951.text: I suppose that's my way of saying I miss you. Tonight, I toast not just the people we've become -

401.speaker: Wyll
401.text: - but the people we were. Warriors. Winners. Saviours. Lovers.

441.speaker: Wyll
441.text: My heart is still yours. And so it will be, until time stops and the planes split to pieces.

848.speaker: Wyll
848.text: - but the people we were. Warriors. Winners. Saviours.

299.speaker: Player
299.text: You've done a lot of killing for a warlock without his powers.

561.speaker: Wyll
561.text: So I stoked new fires in myself using the lessons my father once taught me.

468.speaker: Wyll
468.text: Now the Blade of Frontiers is a ranger - a true hunter of monsters, a warden in more than just name.

716.speaker: Player
716.text: Your father must be proud of you. Have you been visiting?

242.speaker: Wyll
242.text: I've seen him more than a few times. And he's as proud of me as I am of him.

919.speaker: Wyll
919.text: He's leading the city's renewal, opened the Gates to all newcomers, rebuilt the Council from scratch.

251.speaker: Wyll
251.text: And he's back in his element - commanding the Flaming Fist with brave heart and no shortage of empathy.

390.speaker: Player
390.text: And Mizora? Is she next on your kill list?

914.speaker: Wyll
914.text: She's kept herself hidden, the wily arsehole that she is. But turns out, there's a way I could find her.

523.speaker: Wyll
523.text: I'm in contact with a diabolist out in Calimshan, an expert on devils and their infernal tricks. And she's got some thoughts about my ol' sending stone of an eye.

961.speaker: Wyll
961.text: If my patron could use it to track me, we might be able to track her. Or so the theory goes.

946.speaker: Wyll
946.text: We meet in a tenday. If the diabolist's right, the eye could lead me right to Mizora. It's past time her old pet gets to sink in his fangs.

738.speaker: Player
738.text: Mizora must keep you busy with her missions, too.

406.speaker: Wyll
406.text: She's kept her leash loose - though I've been no stranger to the Hells.

212.speaker: Wyll
212.text: Every target she's set me on's been a demonic intruder - tanar'ri assassins who slip into Avernus, armanites that amass near the Styx.

166.speaker: Wyll
166.text: My next mark's the most challenging yet, or so she says. I don't know much more, only that it's no demon - but a devil.

344.speaker: Wyll
344.text: She's playing a game. I don't know what it is, or how she plans to win. But I can tell you this much:

143.speaker: Wyll
143.text: I'd fall on my own blade and join the Blood War in an instant should Zariel's Hells-touched fingers stretch towards the Coast.

161.speaker: Wyll
161.text: And as long as I'm more useful as a warlock, that's not a risk Mizora would take.

364.speaker: Player
364.text: I couldn't say no to a story about a dragon.

245.speaker: Wyll
245.text: There're tales galore of a great green dragon called Claugiyliamatar. Try saying that five times in a row!

691.speaker: Wyll
691.text: 'Claugiyliamatar'. 'Clog-ee-myalarfer'. 'Cloff-a-mother-f...' Whatever - let's call it Old Gnawbone.
691.context: NodeContext: CLOG-ee-lee-uh-MAT-ar. Wyll tries his own game to say the dragon's name five times in a row and fails spectacularly and charmingly.

328.speaker: Wyll
328.text: Turns out, Old Gnawbone had kids. And one of them flew the roost and took to stalking a small elven enclave outside Kryptgarden Forest.

114.speaker: Wyll
114.text: The damn dragon had turned the place into a slave camp before I arrived. Sordid beyond words.

264.speaker: Wyll
264.text: He was a big boy - but still a young'un. A wonder of the skies but a lumbering oaf on the ground.

75.speaker: Wyll
75.text: I tried a sly approach, but the whelp saw me coming and up it flew. Poison poured from its mouth as it descended.

193.speaker: Wyll
193.text: I tumbled away, cast Flesh to Stone, and it crashed to the ground. I could have ended the battle there and then. But this was prey that deserved to be played with.

341.speaker: Wyll
341.text: The beast was a smoking heap of black-green scales once the battle was over. The elves and I sang songs and drank mead in celebration until their barrels went dry.

478.speaker: Wyll
478.text: I tumbled away, shot it with arrows, and it crashed to the ground. I could have ended the battle there and then. But this was prey that deserved to be played with.

280.speaker: Player
280.text: A tale of battle told by Blade of Frontiers? I'm eager to hear!

440.speaker: Player
440.text: A tale of battle told by the Blade of Frontiers, the Heart of the Gate? I'm all ears!

385.speaker: Player
385.text: There's only one hunt I'm interested in hearing about. Have you slain Mizora?

265.speaker: Wyll
265.text: Till then, I'll keep sinking my blades into every monster threatening the Sword Coast. And I've got a story for each and every one.

464.speaker: Player
464.text: It sounds like you're faring well without your infernal powers.

821.speaker: Wyll
821.text: That ranger's left a mountain of corpses in his wake and collected a tale or two. You'd indulge him one, yes?

837.speaker: Player
837.text: I'm not interested in any stories, Wyll.

607.speaker: Wyll
607.text: Anything else on your mind? I'm not a man to keep secrets - not anymore.

643.speaker: Player
643.text: You seem to be faring well without your warlock powers.

883.speaker: Player
883.text: Your father must be proud of you. Have you been visiting?

723.speaker: Player
723.text: Have you gone after Mizora? I'm sure you're eager for payback.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: Still pacted to Mizora, I presume.

622.speaker: Player
622.text: I've turned my mind to political concerns. We seek a powerful ally: the githzerai.

530.speaker: Player
530.text: It continues apace, though it will take time to topple a powerful queen like Vlaakith.

751.speaker: Wyll
751.text: You look positively perfect, if a bit shimmery at the edges.
751.context: NodeContext: EVer so slightly taken aback.

458.speaker: Wyll
458.text: Karlach: You look positively perfect, and only ever so slightly singed.
458.context: NodeContext: EVer so slightly taken aback.

499.speaker: Wyll
499.text: I wager you've cracked open more than your share of hell-heads. You know the thrill of the hunt.

124.speaker: Wyll
124.text: The trolls I've torn open, the ghouls I've cleaved - the stories I've been itching to tell.

688.speaker: Wyll
688.text: You look positively perfect - not a tentacle out of place.
688.context: NodeContext: EVer so slightly taken aback.

198.speaker: Wyll
198.text: But dammit all, you are too bold a soul to be slinking in shadows, tentacles or not.
198.context: NodeContext: EVer so slightly taken aback.

323.speaker: Player
323.text: I made my choice for the good of Faerûn and beyond. I don't regret it.
323.context: NodeContext: EVer so slightly taken aback.

705.speaker: Wyll
705.text: Your sacrifice hasn't gone forgotten. It's afforded me a life of my own making: slaying the beasts of the Coast.

273.speaker: Player
273.text: It's a pathetic life, to be honest. But I make do.
273.context: NodeContext: EVer so slightly taken aback.

435.speaker: Wyll
435.text: I'm sorry. I promise, your sacrifice hasn't gone forgotten. It's afforded me a life of my own making: slaying the beasts of the Coast.

884.speaker: Wyll
884.text: The hunt is both duty and thrill. The trolls I've torn open, the ghouls I've cleaved - the stories I've been itching to tell.

687.speaker: Player
687.text: You're off the mark. To stalk and to feed? You can't imagine a finer pleasure.
687.context: NodeContext: EVer so slightly taken aback.

456.speaker: Wyll
456.text: A different kind of hunt than I'm used to. But I know the thrill.
456.context: NodeContext: EVer so slightly taken aback.

20.speaker: Wyll
20.text: The trolls I've torn open, the ghouls I've cleaved - the stories I've been itching to tell.

318.speaker: Wyll
318.text: By the stars' light and the moon's glow, Gale - it's so good to see you. And you look every bit the god that you are.

612.speaker: Wyll
612.text: No time or inclination to get your divine hands dirty in battle, I wager. What different lives we've come to lead.

502.speaker: Wyll
502.text: Me, I'm bound to the hunt. The trolls I've torn open, the ghouls I've cleaved - the stories I've been itching to tell.

355.speaker: Wyll
355.text: By the stars' light and the moon's glow, Gale - it's so good to see you.

330.speaker: Wyll
330.text: By the stars' light and the moon's glow, it's so good to see you, Astarion.

331.speaker: Wyll
331.text: I suppose a Vampire Ascendant has no time for battle, if a healthy taste for blood.

347.speaker: Wyll
347.text: By the stars' light and the moon's glow, it's so good to see you, Astarion.

243.speaker: Wyll
243.text: I suppose you've been slinking in the night for the occasional feast.

495.speaker: Wyll
495.text: A pity you can't join me in open hunt. The trolls I've torn open, the ghouls I've cleaved - the stories I've been itching to tell.

596.speaker: Wyll
596.text: By the stars' light and the moon's glow, it's so good to see you, Shadowheart.

600.speaker: Wyll
600.text: Does Selûne still bless your path?

775.speaker: Player
775.text: I sense her presence, yes - and Shar's dismay. Her minions have tried to claim my head several times. Tried and failed.

909.speaker: Wyll
909.text: You never were one to shy from battle - or to deny its thrills.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: Yes. She is not a patron I ever expected to have watching over me... but I am glad for her guidance.

145.speaker: Wyll
145.text: You walk a righteous path, Shadowheart. And I wager you don't shy from righteous battles.

701.speaker: Wyll
701.text: If only you could join me. The trolls I've torn open, the ghouls I've cleaved - the stories I've been itching to tell.

165.speaker: Player
165.text: She grants me her divine power, yes. At times I wonder if I am truly deserving of them.

539.speaker: Wyll
539.text: Cast every doubt from your mind. The Moonmaiden doesn't shine her light on the unworthy.

201.speaker: Wyll
201.text: Shar's true favoured, exerting power from the shadows, away from the fields of battle.

859.speaker: Wyll
859.text: Me, I've seen no end to them. The trolls I've torn open, the ghouls I've cleaved - the stories I've been itching to tell.

659.speaker: Wyll
659.text: I wager you've cracked open more kith'raki heads than you could possibly count.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Thirteen kith'raki, twenty-five sarths, and three-hundred-five warriors. Precisely.

225.speaker: Player
225.text: And more to come. I will soon be assaulting a githyanki stronghold in the jungles of Chult.

375.speaker: Player
375.text: Precious few, now that I've taken to the Underdark. I have turned my blade against illithid colonies there.

802.speaker: Player
802.text: I've slain more than githyanki. Tall mouthers living in the Trollclaws, ogres roaming the Forlorn Hills...

329.speaker: Player
329.text: Now that I've settled in Baldur's Gate. My battles are few and far between.

860.speaker: Wyll
860.text: It's so good to see you - and I've got so much to tell!

741.speaker: Wyll
741.text: The trolls I've torn open, the ghouls I've cleaved - the stories I've been itching to tell.

352.speaker: Wyll
352.text: Gods, love - I must look a mess. I'd just rolled out from under a pesky ogre when Withers yanked me in.
352.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll sniffs himself, and grimaces at the beginning.

525.speaker: Wyll
525.text: Have you been... comfortable in the Undercity? Is there anything more I can bring you?

536.speaker: Player
536.text: You've done everything you can. I want for nothing.

366.speaker: Wyll
366.text: And yet deserve so much more.

707.speaker: Wyll
707.text: Oh, before I forget - I've made contact with an assassin, name of Artemis, a killer of killers. Certain arrangements can be made.

376.speaker: Wyll
376.text: Your hunger requires sating. And it's not easy to smuggle the spoils of my hunts.

462.speaker: Wyll
462.text: Speaking of, I've got new stories to tell you. New trolls I've torn open, new ghouls I've cleaved.

481.speaker: Player
481.text: Only so many criminals stalk the Undercity. I need more food, Wyll.

931.speaker: Wyll
931.text: But I've made contact with an assassin, name of Artemis, a killer of killers. Certain arrangements can be made.

388.speaker: Player
388.text: I just want more time with you. I miss you.

927.speaker: Wyll
927.text: I miss you too. I promise, I'll make more time.

260.speaker: Wyll
260.text: And yet you - you look positively perfect. Almost as if you haven't slayed damn near a hundred bugbears these last few months.
260.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

34.speaker: Wyll
34.text: By the Nine Hells, think of the stories we could tell.
34.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

851.speaker: Wyll
851.text: You must have a favourite, yeah? A fight you still savour?
851.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

529.speaker: Player
529.text: Slaughtering that stegosaurus. I'll never forget it.
529.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

178.speaker: Wyll
178.text: Can you believe that wizard had the gall to cast Enlarge on a dino? A miracle it only smashed up a few farmhouses.

584.speaker: Wyll
584.text: Took a brave soul to fell that damned beast. And I'm looking at them now.

624.speaker: Player
624.text: I was sure that lich would be the end of us. I shudder just thinking about it.
624.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

619.speaker: Wyll
619.text: The two of us versus an army of skeletons, each one a piece of the lich's essence. An impossible victory, in hindsight.
619.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

62.speaker: Wyll
62.text: But a victory all the same. Because of your courage, Daggerford still stands.
62.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

725.speaker: Wyll
725.text: Beasts and bandits alike fear your name - and the Sword Coast hails it. My lover, my legend.
725.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

239.speaker: Wyll
239.text: Ah, but we should get back to the celebration. Unless there's something on your mind?
239.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

288.speaker: Player
288.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

327.speaker: Wyll
327.text: Ah. A kiss as sweet as the first you ever gave me.
327.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll kisses you. Short version.

537.speaker: Wyll
537.text: Ah. A kiss as sweet as the first you ever gave me.

522.speaker: Wyll
522.text: Ah. A kiss as sweet as the first you ever gave me.

226.text: Ah. A kiss as sweet as the first you ever gave me.

235.speaker: Wyll
235.text: Ah. A kiss as sweet as the first you ever gave me.

639.speaker: Player
639.text: I'm amazed at how quickly you recovered from losing your warlock powers.

621.speaker: Wyll
621.text: But you stoked new fires in me. The Blade of Frontiers is now the ranger he was destined to be.

295.speaker: Player
295.text: How's your father? You've been in good spirits since your latest visit.

697.speaker: Wyll
697.text: He's doing well. The rebuilding of Baldur's Gate continues apace.

732.speaker: Player
732.text: Mizora's next on the kill list. How did the diabolist visit in Calimshan go?

6.speaker: Wyll
6.text: The woman's an expert on devils and their infernal tricks. And she's got some thoughts about my ol' sending stone of an eye.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: Mizora's missions are few and far between. I'm surprised she's afforded you so much freedom.

677.speaker: Wyll
677.text: I'd fall on my own blade and join the Blood War in an instant should she put you or the Sword Coast in danger.

695.speaker: Wyll
695.text: Mizora wouldn't dare risk it as long as I'm more valuable as a warlock.

750.speaker: Wyll
750.text: Every target she's set me on's been a demonic intruder - tanar'ri assassins who slip into Avernus, armanites that amass near the Styx.

271.speaker: Wyll
271.text: She's playing a game. I just don't know what it is, or how she plans to win.

815.speaker: Player
815.text: The dragon that escaped Deeping Cave. Exhilarating!

714.speaker: Wyll
714.text: The battle was fierce, but it was the celebration after I most remember.

317.speaker: Wyll
317.text: Singing songs, sipping mead with the elves we defended. I still carry their joy with me.

836.speaker: Player
836.text: Nothing stands out, honestly. It's all been a flurry.

72.speaker: Wyll
72.text: Understandable. First a goblin, then a ghast, then a gorgon. One victory becomes ten becomes a hundred.

418.speaker: Wyll
418.text: Cheers to you. Cheers to Withers. Cheers to all of us.
418.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, with the tone of a toast though no goblet to toast with AFAIK.

443.speaker: Wyll
443.text: Ah - there you are. Breathe, my friend. Can you smell it?
443.context: NodeContext: Breathes in heavily. Throughout this path, Wyll should be amiable, confident, and sweet.

379.speaker: Wyll
379.text: Ah - there you are. Breathe, my friend. Can you smell it?
379.context: NodeContext: Breathes in heavily. Throughout this path, Wyll should be amiable, confident, and sweet.

396.speaker: Player
396.text: Breathe deeply and take in the scents around you.

692.speaker: Narrator
692.text: *You take in every scent the night breeze carries. Sweet honeysuckle, tender violets - and an earthy fragrance you can't quite recognise.*

493.speaker: Narrator
493.text: *You take in every scent the night breeze carries. Sweet honeysuckle, tender violets - and an earthy fragrance you can't quite recognise.*

856.text: *You take a deep breath, but you don't notice anything beyond the ordinary.*

757.speaker: Narrator
757.text: *You take a deep breath, but you don't notice anything beyond the ordinary.*

147.speaker: Player
147.text: I smell fragrant flowers and a mysterious accent I can't quite place.

947.speaker: Wyll
947.text: Forest trees draped in moss. Bittersweet, smoky - and that faintest hint of vanilla.

7.speaker: Wyll
7.text: Reminds me of the Wilden Oak, the acorn I gave you - and the promise I made.

141.speaker: Wyll
141.text: For you, I'd destroy every fiend in the deepest Hell. But I think you might just beat me to it.

671.speaker: Wyll
671.text: Who would've thought that just one of them held the key to escaping Avernus for good?

466.speaker: Narrator
466.text: *You think back on the cambion you slayed a tenday ago. It carried a map with directions and blueprints for Zariel's own, private forge.*

666.speaker: Narrator
666.text: *The current plan: sneak in, grab a smith, and force him to repair or replace your heart so you can live outside Avernus.*

550.speaker: Player
550.text: You got it. Next stop, Zariel's forge. Final stop, Faerûn.

234.speaker: Wyll
234.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastically, Karlach's language has rubbed off on him a little.

86.speaker: Wyll
86.text: Oh shit - I'm starting to pick up your bad habits. Well, fuck it. In for a coin, in for a coffer.
86.context: NodeContext: Oopsy - he's been picking up some bad language habits from Karlach!

816.speaker: Wyll
816.text: Just think - if those blueprints are right, we can fix your heart up once and for all.
816.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll blows a kiss at end of line

889.speaker: Wyll
889.text: Imagine swimming in the Chionthar again, travelling cobblestone roads, setting our heads on down pillows.

756.speaker: Wyll
756.text: Just think - if that forge map is real, we won't just be able to fix up your heart, we could reverse engineer my stone eye.
756.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll blows a kiss at end of line

5.speaker: Wyll
5.text: It always led Mizora to me - let's see if we can make it take us to her. It's past time for her old pet to sink in his fangs.
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll blows a kiss at end of line

110.speaker: Wyll
110.text: Well - how about we put the hunt out of our minds for now? The night's young. You shouldn't go wasting it.
110.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll blows a kiss at end of line

587.speaker: Wyll
587.text: Or wasting any of the wine, for that matter. I plan on downing half a bottle myself. Oops - did I say half a bottle? I meant half a dozen.
587.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll blows a kiss at end of line

712.speaker: Wyll
712.text: Oh - and before you saunter off: I love you. Hasn't changed, never will.
712.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll blows a kiss at end of line

694.speaker: Player
694.text: Nothing is a sure thing. Try not to get your hopes up, soldier.

635.speaker: Wyll
635.text: Who needs hope, when we've got your axe and your courage?

765.speaker: Wyll
765.text: And not to pat myself too hard on the back, but I'm not such a bad ranger if I do say so myself.

405.speaker: Wyll
405.text: But we can't pass up the chance, Karlach. Just imagine - swimming in the Chionthar again, travelling cobblestone roads, setting our heads on down pillows.

99.speaker: Wyll
99.text: Besides, the heat's been terrible for my complexion.

877.speaker: Wyll
877.text: But we can't pass up the chance, Karlach. If that forge map is real, we won't just be able to fix up your heart - we could reverse engineer my stone eye.

778.speaker: Wyll
778.text: It always let Mizora track me - let's see if we can make it track her. It's past time for her old pet to sink in his fangs.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: Something's nagging at me. Could be a trap. The sort Zariel likes to set.

125.speaker: Wyll
125.text: So what if it is? All of Avernus is a trap. One false move, you slip into the Styx, and poof - there go your memories.

419.speaker: Wyll
419.text: But we can't pass up the chance. Imagine it, to swim in the Chionthar again, to travel cobblestone roads, to set our heads on down pillows.

793.speaker: Wyll
793.text: But we can't pass up the chance. If that forge map is real, we won't just be able to fix up your heart - we could reverse engineer my stone eye.

735.speaker: Player
735.text: Something's nagging at me. Could be a trap, set by the one and only Mizora.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Even if we succeed, I'm not leaving till we tear Mizora a new arsehole.

850.speaker: Wyll
850.text: That's my Karlach. Loyal to a fault.

920.speaker: Wyll
920.text: If those blueprints work, we won't just be able to fix up your heart - we could reverse engineer my stone eye.

853.speaker: Wyll
853.text: Reminds me of the Wilden Oak. The oldest and most storied tree in all of the Sword Coast.

728.speaker: Wyll
728.text: I used to climb it when father's eye was turned elsewhere - daydream of the legends it might tell, if I listened close enough.

395.speaker: Wyll
395.text: But none of those legends I imagined were as spectacular as the ones we're writing for ourselves.

399.speaker: Wyll
399.text: You've felled enough cambions to build a fortress with their horns.

693.speaker: Wyll
693.text: Almost as legendary as the warrior facing me now. Pretty sure you've felled enough cambions to build a fortress with their horns.

498.speaker: Player
498.text: It's what I don't smell that strikes me. No brimstone, no volcanic ash stuck in my lungs.
498.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll sniffs his armpit at end of line, then lowers it back into position.

133.speaker: Wyll
133.text: And no rancid rancid devil-blood clogging our noses, either. I'm sure you've spilled enough of it to flood the Great Avernus Road.

582.speaker: Wyll
582.text: You're a wonder, Karlach. You've felled enough cambions to build a fortress with their horns.

284.speaker: Player
284.text: Ugh - you're right. We could both do with a good washing.
284.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll sniffs his armpit at end of line, then lowers it back into position.

151.speaker: Wyll
151.text: By the good gods, how bad do I reek?
151.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll sniffs his armpit at end of line, then lowers it back into position.

94.speaker: Wyll
94.text: Shit - dried devils' blood. Stinks like a skunk squatting in an aboleth's corpse.

501.speaker: Wyll
501.text: No wonder. We've felled enough cambions to build a fortress with their horns.

865.speaker: Wyll
865.text: *To your relief, your projection holds. It took a dozen gishes' talents, a few stolen psi crystals, and two tendays of effort to conjure it.*
865.context: CinematicNodeContext: Takes a big breath through his nose before line.

758.speaker: Narrator
758.text: *To your relief, your projection holds. It took a dozen gishes' talents, a few stolen psi crystals, and two tendays of effort to conjure it.*
758.context: CinematicNodeContext: Takes a big breath through his nose before line.

787.speaker: Narrator
787.text: *You can touch, taste, and talk; but your fleshly body is in Limbo, the home of the mystical githzerai. Once, the githzerai were one with the githyanki - until bloody civil war severed the gith species.*
787.context: CinematicNodeContext: Takes a big breath through his nose before line.

911.speaker: Narrator
911.text: *The githzerai god-king, Menyar-Ag-Gith, sent word through the cosmos. He knows of your rebellion - and he's agreed to parley.*
911.context: CinematicNodeContext: Takes a big breath through his nose before line.

967.speaker: Narrator
967.text: *Should the githzerai join you, you could vanquish Vlaakith in a red dragon's blink.*
967.context: CinematicNodeContext: Takes a big breath through his nose before line.

629.speaker: Wyll
629.text: Lae'zel. I knew you'd find a way.
629.context: CinematicNodeContext: Takes a big breath through his nose before line.

969.speaker: Wyll
969.text: Breathe, my friend. Can you smell it?
969.context: CinematicNodeContext: Takes a big breath through his nose before line.

653.speaker: Player
653.text: I smell little more than the un-scent of Limbo.

760.speaker: Wyll
760.text: Limbo - realm of the githzerai? Then the rebellion's taken you far from the Astral.

356.speaker: Wyll
356.text: I'm proud of you, you know. It can't have been easy to turn your back on the lich you called queen.

881.speaker: Wyll
881.text: I imagine you've been cracking kith'raki heads across every plane. Mind you, you're not the only one who's been piling up corpses.

148.speaker: Wyll
148.text: Karlach and I have felled enough cambions to build a fortress with their horns.
148.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

562.speaker: Wyll
562.text: Who would have thought that just one of those fiends held the key to escaping Avernus for good?
562.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

303.speaker: Wyll
303.text: And get this: If those blueprints we found work, I could reverse engineer my stone eye. Instead of Mizora tracking me, I could track her.
303.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

923.speaker: Wyll
923.text: It's past time for her old pet to sink in his fangs.
923.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

215.speaker: Player
215.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

33.text: Ah. A kiss as sweet as the first you ever gave me.
33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll kisses you. Short version.

570.speaker: Wyll
570.text: Ah. A kiss as sweet as the first you ever gave me.

180.speaker: Player
180.text: I've missed travelling with you. You were a pleasure to be around.

849.speaker: Wyll
849.text: I've missed you too. The rush of battles we fought, the heart-to-hearts, the nights around the fire. The comfort of knowing I didn't face the unknown alone.

975.speaker: Wyll
975.text: If I had to do it all over again - and I'd rather not, to be clear! - I can't imagine not having you at my side.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: How have you been faring without your warlock powers?

749.speaker: Wyll
749.text: I think the splinters I made out of the last bone devil I saw speak for themselves.

655.speaker: Wyll
655.text: Not to pat myself too hard on the back, but I'm not such a bad ranger if I do say so myself.

236.speaker: Player
236.text: How long before Mizora becomes a problem, do you think?

205.speaker: Wyll
205.text: She's kept me on a long leash, if you can believe it. Every target she's set me on's been a demonic intruder - tanar'ri assassins who slip into Avernus, armanites that amass near the Styx.

158.speaker: Wyll
158.text: My next target's the most challenging yet, or so she says. I don't know much more, only that it's no demon - but a devil.

307.speaker: Wyll
307.text: I'm not worried, not when you both have my back. I swear you two could scare the eyes off a beholder.

952.speaker: Wyll
952.text: I'm not worried, not when Karlach's got my back. I swear she could scare the eyes off a beholder.

508.speaker: Player
508.text: And Mizora? What part does she play in all this?

321.speaker: Player
321.text: I'm glad you could slip away to see your father. He must be so proud of you.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: Have you had any time to visit your father?

663.speaker: Wyll
663.text: Well, that's enough hell-talk for the moment. The night's young. You shouldn't go wasting it.

206.speaker: Wyll
206.text: One of them sported a map and some blueprints. If you want all the gory details, Karlach can fill you in. But get this:

922.speaker: Wyll
922.text: If those blueprints work, I could reverse engineer my stone eye. Instead of Mizora tracking me, I could track her.

934.speaker: Wyll
934.text: If those blueprints work, we might be able to fix Karlach - and she might be able to go home to Faerûn.

766.speaker: Wyll
766.text: One of them sported a map and some blueprints. If you want all the gory details, Karlach can fill you in.

796.speaker: Player
796.text: I'm a psionic projection. Do I look like I can smell anything?

387.speaker: Wyll
387.text: I wager not. Well, probably for the best - I can smell only the sweet honeysuckle in the air. Karlach insists I reek with the blood of a hundred devils.

497.speaker: Wyll
497.text: No wonder. Karlach and I have felled enough cambions to build a fortress with their horns.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Only faintly, I'm afraid. I miss the sweet scents of the Sword Coast. And I miss you.

876.speaker: Wyll
876.text: I miss you too. I'm glad you could, er, project your way in, or however it works.

510.speaker: Wyll
510.text: There you are, my love. Breathe deep. Can you smell it?

129.speaker: Player
129.text: I smell fragrant flowers and a mysterious accent I can't quite place.

504.speaker: Wyll
504.text: A far cry from the rancid Avernus heat that's been clogging my lungs.

460.speaker: Wyll
460.text: I swear, the three of us have felled enough cambions to build a fortress with their horns.

359.speaker: Wyll
359.text: I swear, Karlach and I have felled enough cambions to build a fortress with their horns.

448.speaker: Player
448.text: I noticed the scent of sulphur. It's awful - is that you?

527.speaker: Wyll
527.text: No wonder. The three of us have felled enough cambions to build a fortress with their horns.

213.speaker: Player
213.text: Smell what? The material plane can hardly compete with the aromas of Elysium.

948.speaker: Wyll
948.text: You don't know what you're missing. The sweetness of honeysuckle, the earthiness of splitting oak.

89.speaker: Wyll
89.text: There you are, my friend. Breathe deep. Can you smell it?

580.speaker: Wyll
580.text: A great Warrior of the Comet walks among us! Looking as stunning as ever - if a bit less corporeal than I expected.
580.context: NodeContext: Wyll sniffs himself, and grimaces at the beginning.

827.speaker: Wyll
827.text: A great Warrior of the Comet walks among us! Looking as stunning as ever - if a bit less corporeal than I expected.
827.context: NodeContext: Wyll sniffs himself, and grimaces at the beginning.

553.speaker: Wyll
553.text: A great Warrior of the Comet walks among us! Looking as stunning as ever - if a bit less corporeal than I expected.
553.context: NodeContext: Wyll sniffs himself, and grimaces at the beginning.

455.speaker: Wyll
455.text: The great warrior Lae'zel walks among us! Well, a projection of her, at least.
455.context: NodeContext: Wyll sniffs himself, and grimaces at the beginning.

113.speaker: Wyll
113.text: A great Warrior of the Comet walks among us! Well - a projection of them, at least.
113.context: NodeContext: Wyll sniffs himself, and grimaces at the beginning.

349.speaker: Wyll
349.text: Phew - probably for the best. I smell like a seventy-year-old cinder.
349.context: NodeContext: Wyll sniffs himself, and grimaces at the beginning.

543.speaker: Wyll
543.text: Withers yanked me from Avernus with my blade halfway through a cambion's belly without so much as a chance at a washing up.

804.speaker: Wyll
804.text: And you? I wager you've cracked open more kith'raki heads than you could possibly count.

763.speaker: Player
763.text: Thirteen kith'raki, twenty-five sarths, and three-hundred-five warriors. Precisely.

378.speaker: Wyll
378.text: Then you did keep count. I should've known you would!

686.speaker: Player
686.text: I've turned my mind to political concerns. We seek a powerful ally: the githzerai.

891.speaker: Wyll
891.text: Diplomacy - not so different from fighting, I find. You still grip your blade, you just hide it beneath a silken glove.

888.speaker: Player
888.text: Our fight continues apace, though it will take time to topple a powerful queen like Vlaakith.

259.speaker: Wyll
259.text: Not to mention the mightiest magic you can muster and the sharpest swords you can forge.

880.speaker: Wyll
880.text: How you'd thrill in the hellhunt. Slaying fiends is electrifying. The demons I've disintegrated, the devilkin I've bled - the stories I've been itching to tell.

679.speaker: Wyll
679.text: How you'd thrill in the hellhunt, Lae'zel. Slaying fiends is electrifying. The demons I've disintegrated, the devilkin I've bled - the stories I've been itching to tell.

222.speaker: Wyll
222.text: Ah, I don't suppose you'd indulge me?

179.speaker: Player
179.text: Go on, Mister Blade. Let's see how you stack up against me!

171.speaker: Wyll
171.text: Yes - let's see how I compare to the fierce flame that is Karlach!

21.speaker: Wyll
21.text: You'll have to choose one tale though, or I'll be yammering all night!

972.speaker: Wyll
972.text: You want to hear about the amnizu at the Styx, the three-tusked orthon, or the invading goristroi?

386.speaker: Player
386.text: I want to hear about the amnizu.

368.speaker: Wyll
368.text: Styx devils, they're called. They usually prefer the frozen wastes of Stygia, but Zariel's got a few of her own for guarding the River of Blood.

916.speaker: Wyll
916.text: Fat bastards, all of them. Was on the heels of a merregon who'd been stalking the Wild Hills and sprinted a little too close to the Styx.

496.speaker: Wyll
496.text: I felt my mind start to drain - an amnizu specialty. Bought just enough time for one of its minions to grab me and dangle me over the river.

278.speaker: Wyll
278.text: Could feel the Styx tugging at my memories as I hung over it, eager to drink me dry.

608.speaker: Wyll
608.text: Good thing I never touch foot in the Hells without my companion wolf Lily.

603.speaker: Wyll
603.text: She was just the distraction I needed. She nipped at the minion's heels and I leapt from its grasp, unsheathed my shortswords, and rushed at the amnizu in a fury.

290.speaker: Wyll
290.text: When we'd finished, all that remained was a pair of paltry wings atop a pile of viscera.

189.speaker: Wyll
189.text: But not even the Hells' minions are immune to a Circle of Death. And I had just enough strength left to conjure one.

708.speaker: Wyll
708.text: I leapt free of the minion's grasp, unsheathed my shortswords, and rushed at the amnizu in a fury.

592.speaker: Wyll
592.text: When I'd finished, all that remained was a pair of paltry wings atop a pile of viscera.

46.speaker: Wyll
46.text: Word travels fast when a devil crosses the Delimbiyr Vale near Daggerford.

335.speaker: Wyll
335.text: It had travelled a hellrift to a long-forsaken shrine. Luckily, the trail it scorched into the frontiers was hard to miss.
335.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

730.speaker: Wyll
730.text: It led to an isle of cracked rock in Avernus floating amid a molten sea. The orthon stood heaving, breath like brimstone and ash.
730.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

446.speaker: Wyll
446.text: And then it charged, splitting the ground with every thud, so fast it left a trail of smoke. I could barely nick it - not with a blade, not with an eldritch blast.
446.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

306.speaker: Wyll
306.text: It was the wardevil's weight that proved its own undoing.
306.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

968.speaker: Wyll
968.text: The third charge it made, I struck the rock with Scorching Ray. The ground split apart the moment the beast stomped onto it.
968.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

662.speaker: Wyll
662.text: The third charge it made, I struck the rock with Hail of Thorns. The ground split apart the moment the beast stomped onto it.
662.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

283.speaker: Wyll
283.text: The orthon slowly sunk, howling into the magma beneath. I let two of its tusks sink with it; the third I sliced free and presented to the First Duke of Daggerford, a rare trophy to grace his walls.
283.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

132.speaker: Player
132.context: InternalNodeContext: If we have the bandwith to add some kissing to this dialog

490.speaker: Wyll
490.text: Ah. A kiss as sweet as the first you ever gave me.
490.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll kisses you. Short version.

402.text: Ah. A kiss as sweet as the first you ever gave me.

965.speaker: Wyll
965.text: Ah. A kiss as sweet as the first you ever gave me.

203.speaker: Wyll
203.text: If only you could stay here with me on the Coast. But Karlach's heart needs you more than mine.

428.speaker: Wyll
428.text: But one day, the flames will be doused and Karlach's heart will be cured. I'm certain of it.

610.speaker: Wyll
610.text: And that, my love, is the day we can finally be together.

926.speaker: Wyll
926.text: When I lay to rest, I like to imagine you atop a red dragon, soaring across the endless night.

506.speaker: Wyll
506.text: Even when brimstone fills my lungs and magma laps at my feet, it brings me comfort knowing you shine bright among the stars.

258.speaker: Wyll
258.text: I look forward to the day I've doused Karlach's fires and you've conquered the skies.

30.speaker: Wyll
30.text: For that is the day we can finally be together.

685.speaker: Player
685.text: I've missed travelling with you. You were a pleasure to be around.

854.speaker: Player
854.text: I've missed travelling with you. You were a pleasure to be around.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Incredible story. I wish I'd been there to see it play out.

342.speaker: Wyll
342.text: So do I. Though I'm sure your stories of conquest overshadow mine.

939.speaker: Wyll
939.text: Still - even when brimstone fills my lungs and magma laps at my feet, it brings me comfort knowing you shine bright among the stars.

292.speaker: Player
292.text: You've done a lot of killing for a warlock without his powers.

53.speaker: Wyll
53.text: I won't lie - losing the eldritch blasts and the hexes took some getting used to. Nothing but void where once there was hellfire.

834.speaker: Wyll
834.text: So I stoked new fires in myself using the lessons my father once taught me. The Blade of Avernus is a ranger - a hunter of the most hellish prey.

938.speaker: Player
938.text: Your father must be proud of you. Have you been visiting?

810.speaker: Player
810.text: And Mizora? Is she next on your kill list?

228.speaker: Player
228.text: I'm surprised Mizora's afforded you so much freedom.

444.speaker: Wyll
444.text: She's kept me on a long leash, if you can believe it.

604.speaker: Wyll
604.text: Go on, my treasure, the night's young. You shouldn't waste a moment of it.

936.speaker: Wyll
936.text: Or waste a single drop of wine, for that matter. I plan on downing a half a bottle myself. Oops - did I say half a bottle? I meant half a dozen.

475.speaker: Wyll
475.text: Go on, the night's young. You shouldn't waste a moment of it.

590.speaker: Wyll
590.text: And then it charged, splitting the ground with every thud, so fast it left a trail of smoke. I could barely nick it - not with a blade, not with an arrow.

761.speaker: Wyll
761.text: Not just a pair but a pack. Demonkin with no business treading the Hells. Seems they had sights on a paeliryon, one of Zariel's spies -

905.speaker: Wyll
905.text: At least, until I caught their eye. I wasn't the hunter anymore. I was the hunted - and they were the first to land a blow. Hoof to the back, left a right nasty scar.

374.speaker: Wyll
374.text: Good thing for me, I'd learned every goristro's weakness: they're dumb as bugbears on a bender. Throw something shiny, and they'll chase it.

252.speaker: Wyll
252.text: Tossed a handful of gold pieces and they scattered. I summoned a few stinking clouds, and they dropped before grabbing a single coin.

281.speaker: Wyll
281.text: Slit their necks for good measure. The damn things may be stupid, but they're sturdy, and I wasn't in the mood for nasty surprises.

941.speaker: Wyll
941.text: Tossed a handful of gold pieces and they scattered. A flurry of arrows dropped them before they could grab a single coin.

906.speaker: Player
906.text: A tale of battle told by the legendary Blade of Avernus? I'm all ears!

78.speaker: Wyll
78.text: Yes! But just the one, or I'll be yammering all night.

422.speaker: Wyll
422.text: You'll have to choose one tale and one tale only, I'm afraid, or I'll be yammering all night!

924.speaker: Player
924.text: There's only one devil hunt I'm interested in hearing about. Have you slain Mizora?

232.speaker: Wyll
