232.text: Till then, I'll keep sinking my blades into every fiend with its eyes trained on the Sword Coast. And I've got a story for each and every one.

771.speaker: Player
771.text: It sounds like you're faring well without your infernal powers.

190.speaker: Wyll
190.text: That ranger's left a mountain of corpses in his wake and collected a tale or two. You'd indulge him one, yes?

896.speaker: Player
896.text: I'm not interested in any stories, Wyll.

667.speaker: Wyll
667.text: Understandable - given the chance, I could yammer all night!

940.speaker: Wyll
940.text: Anything else on your mind? I'm an open book - if a bit scorched at the edges.

362.speaker: Player
362.text: You seem to be faring well without your warlock powers.

915.speaker: Player
915.text: Have you gone after Mizora? I'm sure you're eager for payback.

746.speaker: Player
746.text: Still pacted to Mizora, I presume.

204.speaker: Wyll
204.text: I wish you'd come with me. Do battle together, just like the old days.

487.speaker: Wyll
487.text: I miss you. Tonight, I toast not just the people we've become -

275.speaker: Wyll
275.text: - but the people we were. Warriors. Winners. Saviours. Lovers.

465.speaker: Wyll
465.text: My heart is still yours. And so it will be, until time stops and the planes split to pieces.

197.speaker: Wyll
197.text: Now go on, the night's young. You shouldn't waste a moment of it.

297.speaker: Wyll
297.text: Or a single drop of wine, for that matter. I plan on downing at least half a bottle. Oops - did I say half a bottle? I meant half a dozen.

372.speaker: Wyll
372.text: I long for you every moment I'm away.

172.speaker: Wyll
172.text: And you? I wager you and Lae'zel have cracked open more kith'raki heads than you could possibly count.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Too right. We could fill rivers with all the blood we've spilled.

97.speaker: Wyll
97.text: Then you're right in your element.

843.speaker: Player
843.text: We've taken a more politic approach and seek to ally with the githzerai.

315.speaker: Wyll
315.text: Gods, I smell like a seventy-year-old cinder.
315.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll sniffs himself, and grimaces at the beginning.

3.speaker: Wyll
3.text: My love! Oh gods, I smell like a seventy-year-old cinder.
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll sniffs himself, and grimaces at the beginning.

469.speaker: Wyll
469.text: And from the smell of it, you're in the same condition.
469.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll sniffs the air before line.

577.speaker: Wyll
577.text: Well, never mind that. By the living gods, Karlach, It's so good to see you.

717.speaker: Wyll
717.text: I can hardly believe we haven't crossed paths. I wager you've cracked open more than your share of hell-heads.

731.speaker: Wyll
731.text: Electrifying, isn't it? The demons I've disintegrated, the devilkin I've bled - the stories I could tell.

676.speaker: Wyll
676.text: Well, never mind that. By the stars' light and the moon's glow, it's so good to see you.
676.context: NodeContext: EVer so slightly taken aback.

115.speaker: Wyll
115.text: But dammit all, you are too bold a soul to be slinking in shadows.
115.context: NodeContext: EVer so slightly taken aback.

542.speaker: Player
542.text: I made my choice for the good of Faerûn and beyond. I don't regret it.
542.context: NodeContext: EVer so slightly taken aback.

626.speaker: Wyll
626.text: Your sacrifice has not gone forgotten. It's afforded me a life of my own making: hunting and hellslaughter.

616.speaker: Player
616.text: It's a pathetic life, to be honest. But I make do.
616.context: NodeContext: EVer so slightly taken aback.

182.speaker: Wyll
182.text: I'm sorry. I promise, your sacrifice has not gone forgotten. It's afforded me a life of my own making: hunting and hellslaughter.

108.speaker: Wyll
108.text: The hellhunt is both duty and thrill. The demons I've disintegrated, the devilkin I've bled - the stories I could tell.

414.speaker: Player
414.text: You're off the mark. To stalk and to feed? You can't imagine a finer pleasure.
414.context: NodeContext: EVer so slightly taken aback.

743.speaker: Wyll
743.text: I, uh - I'll have to take your word for it, but I won't question it.
743.context: NodeContext: EVer so slightly taken aback.

774.speaker: Wyll
774.text: My thrill is the hellhunt. The demons I've disintegrated, the devilkin I've bled - the stories I could tell.

96.speaker: Wyll
96.text: Well, never mind that. By the stars' light and the moon's glow, it's so good to see you. And you look every bit the god that you are.

950.speaker: Wyll
950.text: No time or inclination to get your divine hands dirty in battle, I wager. What different lives we've come to lead.

343.speaker: Wyll
343.text: Me, I'm bound to the hellhunt. The demons I've disintegrated, the devilkin I've bled - the stories I could tell.

407.speaker: Wyll
407.text: Well, never mind that. By the stars' light and the moon's glow, it's so good to see you, Gale.

253.speaker: Wyll
253.text: Well, never mind that. By the stars' light and the moon's glow, it's so good to see you, Astarion.

784.speaker: Wyll
784.text: I suppose a Vampire Ascendant has no time for battle, if a healthy taste for blood.

296.speaker: Wyll
296.text: A pity you can't be there for the hellhunt; you'd grow fat from infernal drippings. The demons I've disintegrated, the devilkin I've gutted - the stories I could tell.

248.speaker: Wyll
248.text: Well, never mind that. By the stars' light and the moon's glow, it's so good to see you, Astarion.

963.speaker: Wyll
963.text: I suppose you've been slinking in the night for the occasional feast.

472.speaker: Wyll
472.text: Well, never mind that. By the stars' light and the moon's glow, it's so good to see you, Shadowheart.

727.speaker: Wyll
727.text: Does Selûne still bless your path?

925.speaker: Player
925.text: I sense her presence, yes - and Shar's dismay. Her minions have tried to claim my head several times. Tried and failed.

634.speaker: Wyll
634.text: You never were one to shy from battle - or to deny its thrills.

417.speaker: Player
417.text: Yes. She is not a patron I ever expected to have watching over me... but I am glad for her guidance.

568.speaker: Wyll
568.text: You walk a righteous path, Shadowheart. And I wager you don't shy from righteous battles.

426.speaker: Wyll
426.text: In Avernus, there is no end to them. The demons I've disintegrated, the devilkin I've bled - the stories I could tell.

721.speaker: Player
721.text: She grants me her divine power, yes. At times I wonder if I am truly deserving of them.

921.speaker: Wyll
921.text: Cast every doubt from your mind. The Moonmaiden doesn't shine her light on the unworthy.

413.speaker: Wyll
413.text: Forgive me, Mother Superior - by the stars' light and the moon's glow, it's so good to see you.

844.speaker: Wyll
844.text: Truly Shar's favoured, as I understand. You exert your power from the shadows, away from the fields of battle.

185.speaker: Wyll
185.text: Well, never mind that. By the stars' light and the moon's glow, it's so good to see you, Lae'zel.

488.speaker: Wyll
488.text: I wager you've cracked open more kith'raki heads than you could possibly count.

683.speaker: Player
683.text: Thirteen kith'raki, twenty-five sarths, and three-hundred-five warriors. Precisely.

895.speaker: Player
895.text: And more to come. I will soon be assaulting a githyanki stronghold in the jungles of Chult.

319.speaker: Wyll
319.text: So your blade is sharp as ever, Lae'zel of K'liir - to no one's surprise.

520.speaker: Wyll
520.text: How you would thrill in the depths of Avernus. Slaying fiends is electrifying. The demons I've disintegrated, the devilkin I've bled - the stories I could tell.

208.speaker: Player
208.text: Precious few, now that I've taken to the Underdark. I have turned my blade against illithid colonies there.

885.speaker: Wyll
885.text: Yet a warrior you remain, Lae'zel of K'liir - to no one's surprise.

528.speaker: Player
528.text: I've slain more than githyanki. Tall mouthers living in the Trollclaws, ogres roaming the Forlorn Hills...

825.speaker: Player
825.text: Now that I've settled in Baldur's Gate, my battles are few and far between.

470.speaker: Wyll
470.text: Yet a warrior's heart still beats within you, Lae'zel of K'liir. It's as plain as the stars in this very sky.

492.speaker: Wyll
492.text: Oh, forget all that. By the stars' light and the moon's glow, it's so good to see you - and I've got so much to tell you!

897.speaker: Wyll
897.text: The hellhunt's no mere duty - it's a thrill. The demons I've disintegrated, the devilkin I've bled - the stories I could share.

293.speaker: Wyll
293.text: My love! Oh gods, I smell like a seventy-year-old cinder.
293.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll sniffs himself, and grimaces at the beginning.

958.speaker: Wyll
958.text: Have you been... comfortable in the Undercity? Is there anything more I can bring you?

447.speaker: Player
447.text: You've done everything you can. I want for nothing.

85.speaker: Wyll
85.text: And yet deserve so much more.

135.speaker: Wyll
135.text: Oh, before I forget - I've made contact with an assassin, name of Artemis, a killer of killers. Certain arrangements can be made.

684.speaker: Wyll
684.text: Your hunger requires sating. And it's not easy to smuggle the spoils of my hunts.

149.speaker: Wyll
149.text: Speaking of, I've got new stories to tell you - demented devils, demons turned to gore.

548.speaker: Player
548.text: Only so many criminals stalk the Undercity. I need more food, Wyll.

461.speaker: Wyll
461.text: But I've made contact with an assassin, name of Artemis, a killer of killers. Certain arrangements can be made.

439.speaker: Player
439.text: I just want more time with you. I miss you.

509.speaker: Wyll
509.text: I miss you too. I promise, I'll make more time.

119.speaker: Wyll
119.text: By the Nine Hells, think of the stories we could tell. The demons we've disintegrated, the devilkin we've bled.

711.speaker: Wyll
711.text: You must have a favourite, yeah? A fight you still savour?

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Taking down the amnizu was a fight for the ages.

534.speaker: Wyll
534.text: You were amazing. When it was over, all that remained was a pair of paltry wings atop a pile of viscera.

690.speaker: Wyll
690.text: The Hells fear your name - and the Sword Coast hails it. My lover, my legend.

183.speaker: Wyll
183.text: Ah, but we should get back to the celebration. Unless there's something on your mind?

13.speaker: Player
13.text: I'm amazed at how quickly you recovered from losing your warlock powers.

219.speaker: Wyll
219.text: But you stoked new fires in me. The Blade of Avernus is now the ranger he was destined to be.

118.speaker: Player
118.text: How's your father? You've been in good spirits since your latest visit.

567.speaker: Wyll
567.text: He's doing well. The rebuilding of Baldur's Gate continues apace.

637.speaker: Player
637.text: Mizora's next on the kill list. How did the diabolist visit in Calimshan go?

602.speaker: Wyll
602.text: The woman's an expert on devils and their infernal tricks. And she's got some thoughts about my ol' sending stone of an eye.

211.speaker: Player
211.text: Mizora's missions are few and far between. I'm surprised she's afforded you so much freedom.

489.speaker: Wyll
489.text: I'd fall on my own blade and join the Blood War in an instant should she put you or the Sword Coast in danger.

104.speaker: Wyll
104.text: Mizora wouldn't dare risk it as long as I'm more valuable as a warlock.

188.speaker: Wyll
188.text: Every target she's set me on's been a demonic intruder - tanar'ri assassins who slip into Avernus, armanites that amass near the Styx.

647.speaker: Wyll
647.text: She's playing a game. I just don't know what it is, or how she plans to win.

431.speaker: Player
431.text: That three-tusked orthon? My heart still races thinking about it.

718.speaker: Wyll
718.text: I'll never forget its howls as it sank into the magma.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: I can't believe we triumphed over a pack of goristroi.

822.speaker: Wyll
822.text: Thank the Abyss that they're as stupid as they are greedy. Throwing those coins was a stroke of sheer genius.

482.speaker: Player
482.text: Nothing stands out, honestly. It's all been a flurry.

606.speaker: Wyll
606.text: Understandable. First six devils, then sixteen, sixty, six-hundred. All that remains is a trail of gore.

696.speaker: Wyll
696.text: Gods, I must look a mess. I'd just rolled out from under a pesky ogre when Withers yanked me in.
